pullRequest.title: Update slot status after a slot move message.
pullRequest.bodyText: This will ensure a correct slot status after a dispatch or other moves between slots.

commit.message: Update slot status after a slot move message.
iI should actually call the routine, it would help just a tad.

Use a delayedslot read to update slot
after setting to common, dispatching, true moveing.
When disposing only set common if currently inuse, let CS do its stuff
Dont set slot common after dispatch, the move could be rejected, just get the new status.

Refocus to the effects of changing to common, the slot move
was a bit of a red herring
Alter tests for new slot refresh
iAdd refresh button to Loconet Slot Monitor.:wq!

nodes.bodyText: I expected Spotbugs to fail on this. meterTask is first assigned to null and then assigned to a TimerTask. Spotbugs normally doesn't accept this since the null value is not used.

commit.message:
This should keep Dan and Oracle  happy. It looks cleaner.
But, from docs.oracle.com "It's not always necessary to assign a value when a field is declared.
   Fields that are declared but not initialized will be set to a reasonable default by the compiler.
   Generally speaking, this default will be zero or null, depending on the data type.
   Relying on such default values, however, is generally considered bad programming style."
